if [ -f "$file" ]; then
    LINES=$(wc -l < "$file")
    FUNCS=$(grep -cE '^\s*(def |async def |function |const .* = |class )' "$file" || echo 0)
    echo "File: $file"
    echo "Lines: $LINES"
    echo "Functions: $FUNCS"
    if [ "$LINES" -gt 200 ] || [ "$FUNCS" -gt 10 ]; then
        echo "NEEDS_SIMPLIFY=true"
    else
        echo "NEEDS_SIMPLIFY=false"
    fi
fi

operations.command: find /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy/.planning/phases -name "*-UAT.md" -type f 2>/dev/null | head -5

# Test 1: Deployment exists in monitoring namespace
kubectl get deployment trading-metrics-api -n monitoring -o jsonpath='{.status.replicas}' 2>/dev/null && echo " replicas configured"

# Test 2: Service exists
kubectl get svc trading-metrics-api -n monitoring -o jsonpath='{.spec.clusterIP}' 2>/dev/null && echo " - service IP"

# Test 3: Pods are running (even if not ready)
kubectl get pods -n monitoring -l app=trading-metrics-api -o jsonpath='{.items[*].status.phase}' 2>/dev/null

# Test 4: Health endpoint works (via port-forward)
kubectl port-forward -n monitoring svc/trading-metrics-api 8082:8080 &
PF_PID=$!
sleep 3
HEALTH=$(curl -s http://localhost:8082/health 2>/dev/null)
kill $PF_PID 2>/dev/null
echo "$HEALTH"

# Test 5: 6 trading ClusterAnalysisTemplates exist
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates -l analysis-type=trading -o name | wc -l

# Test 6: All expected templates present
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates -l analysis-type=trading -o jsonpath='{range .items[*]}{.metadata.name}{"\n"}{end}' | sort

# Test 7: trading-full-check has all 4 metrics
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplate trading-full-check -o jsonpath='{range .spec.metrics[*]}{.name}{"\n"}{end}'

# Test 8: Fail-safe config (failureLimit=0)
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplate trading-var -o jsonpath='{.spec.metrics[0].failureLimit}'
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplate trading-var -o jsonpath='{.metadata.labels}'

# Re-run Test 5 with correct query
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates -l 'analysis-type=trading' --no-headers | wc -l

# Try without quotes
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --selector=analysis-type=trading --no-headers 2>&1 | head -10

# Check if it's a CRD label selector issue
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name,LABELS:.metadata.labels 2>&1

# Count trading templates by name pattern
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --no-headers | grep "^trading-" | wc -l

# Direct grep
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --no-headers 2>&1

# Count properly
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --no-headers 2>&1 | grep -c "^trading-"

# The output has leading spaces - use awk
kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --no-headers 2>&1 | awk '/trading-/{count++} END{print count}'

# Simple approach
echo "$(kubectl get clusteranalysistemplates --no-headers 2>&1 | grep trading | wc -l) trading templates found"

cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add .planning/phases/04-trading-metrics/04-UAT.md && git commit -m "test(phase-04): complete UAT - 8 passed, 0 issues
